name: UIPushBehavior
desc: A behavior that applies a continuous or instantaneous force to one or more dynamic items, causing those items to change position accordingly.

items.name: var active: Bool
items.desc: The state of the push behavior’s force: either active or inactive.

items.name: func addItem(UIDynamicItem)
items.desc: Adds a dynamic item to the behavior’s dynamic item array.

items.name: init(items: [UIDynamicItem], mode: UIPushBehavior.Mode)
items.desc: Initializes a push behavior with an array of dynamic items.

items.name: func removeItem(UIDynamicItem)
items.desc: Removes a specific dynamic item from the behavior.

items.name: var items: [UIDynamicItem]
items.desc: Returns the set of dynamic items you’ve added to the push behavior.

items.name: func setAngle(CGFloat, magnitude: CGFloat)
items.desc: Sets the angle and magnitude of the force vector for the behavior.

items.name: var angle: CGFloat
items.desc: The angle, in radians, of the force vector for the behavior.

items.name: var magnitude: CGFloat
items.desc: The magnitude of the force vector for the push behavior.

items.name: var mode: UIPushBehavior.Mode
items.desc: Returns the force mode for the push behavior.

items.name: func setTargetOffsetFromCenter(UIOffset, for: UIDynamicItem)
items.desc: Sets the offset, from the center of a dynamic item, at which to apply the push behavior’s force vector.

items.name: func targetOffsetFromCenter(for: UIDynamicItem) -> UIOffset
items.desc: Returns the offset, from the center of a dynamic item, at which the push behavior’s force vector is applied.

items.name: var pushDirection: CGVector
items.desc: The direction of the force vector for the behavior, expressed as x and y components and using standard UIKit geometry.

items.name: enum UIPushBehavior.Mode
items.desc: The type of force for the push behavior.
